title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Wednesday 27 September 2017 - BBC News
summary: woman found dead in bungalow named by police .
detectives continue to question man on sus of murder .
theatre community 'disappointed ' by assembly rooms replacement .
angry man hit woman and attacked car .

documents.title: notts can get even better - nolan
text: notts can get even better - nolan

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for regular updates us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the east midlands .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night .

documents.title: weather : rain on its way
text: rain will arrive from the west through the evening and will be accompanied by strengthening wind .
it will move east overnight but should clear and ease by dawn .
lows of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Anna Church
Weather Presenter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: northants keep promotion hopes alive
text: northants keep promotion hopes alive

documents.title: royal opening for new university of derby building
text: here 's another photo of prince edward opening the university of derby 's new engineering and technology building in markeaton street earlier .
the earl of wessex was given a tour of the £ 12m facility and offered culinary treats prepared by catering students from the university .
his derbyshire visit also included stops at a holiday retreat for disadvantaged children in ashbourne and trent college in long eaton .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: read ton puts notts close to promotion
text: read ton puts notts close to promotion

documents.title: glossop halls set for £ 7m revamp
text: plans have been announced for a multimillion-pound refurbishment of three council-owned buildings in glossop .

high peak borough council says it wants to transform the market hall , town hall and municipal buildings to use as `` leisure , community and retail space with a particular focus on the culture and creative sector '' .
the authority has allocated £ 2.2m to the project and is applying for a further £ 4.8m from the heritage lottery fund .
council leader tony ashton said he was `` excited '' by the plans but acknowledged `` there is a long way to go '' .
you can read more about the project here .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman injured after gun shot in mansfield
text: a gun was shot in gladstone street , mansfield , in the early hours of this morning .
a woman was treated for injuries , which were not thought to be life saving , after police were called to a disturbance in a property on the street .
insp nick butler said : `` this is a very concerning matter and as you 'd imagine we are treating it very seriously . ''
he said the force was `` working on the theory that this incident is isolated '' .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police name woman found dead at home
text: a woman found dead at her home in fleckney has been named as jane hings .
the 72-year-old was found in her bungalow in elizabeth road at about 08:00 on sunday .
a post mortem exam has so far failed to identify her cause of death but leicestershire police said they were still waiting for the results of more medical and forensic tests .
a 25-year-old man arrested in connection with her death remains in custody on sus of murder .
officers also arrested a 15-year-old boy today on sus of assisting an offender and remains in custody .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: glos pair excel before rain ends play
text: glos pair excel before rain ends play

documents.title: watch : university invents 3d selfie software
text: this is pretty cool
computer scientists at the university of nottingham are taking the idea of the selfie literally into the next dimension - as a 3d selfie .
the university has uploaded the demo version of their software and 400,000 people have already submitted for the treatment .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: siemens to merge with french firm instead of bombardier
text: german train company siemens has opted to sign a merger deal with french firm alstom rather than bombardier .
reports some months ago suggested bombardier , which has a major manufacturing base in derby , was in `` advanced talks '' with siemens over plans to merge - but that 's fallen through .
alstom makes france 's high speed tgv trains .
there 's no clear indication the decision will have any effect on bombardier 's derby operation .
author: Wesley Mallin
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: football : burton 'shellshocked ' in heavy aston villa defeat
text: burton albion manager nigel clough says his side looked a `` little bit shellshocked '' at half-time as they were 3-0 down to aston villa by then .
the visitors eventually won 4-0 with the brewers conceding four or more goals for the third time this month in cup and league , after a 5-0 loss to leeds united and 4-1 to manchester united .
i thought we started the game extremely well and to come in 3-0 down , we were a little bit shellshocked .
the result was very poor but the performance was n't too bad at all tonight .
i think in the game they [ villa ] have had four or five shots and scored four goals
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: views wanted on £ 100m melton mowbray road plan
text: more people are being urged to give their views on a £ 100m road project aimed at cutting congestion in melton mowbray .
leicestershire county council wants to build a new road , passing around the edge of the town centre , to ease traffic .
the authority says the proposal is the most ambitious road scheme in its history and would also fit in with plans for more houses and jobs in the town .
local residents have until mid-october to take part in the consultation .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: appeal over 'street robbery '
text: cctv images have been released of two boys who police want to speak to in connection with an alleged robbery in derby .
an armani watch was among the items stolen , derbyshire police said .
it happened on kentmere close on 24 july at about 18:00 .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: on this day : foxes up first champions league victory
text: it 's exactly a year to the day leicester city up their first ever home win in the champions league , beating porto 1-0 at the king power stadium .
the foxes would end up reaching the quarter-finals before being knocked out by atletico madrid .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricketer charged with exposure
text: cricketer charged with exposure

documents.title: prince edward visits derbyshire
text: prince edward has been in derbyshire today .
the earl of wessex officially opened a new technology and engineering block at the university of derby and visited a retreat centre for disadvantaged children in ashbourne .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'garden village ' plans for army base
text: 'garden village ' plans for army base

documents.title: watch : your assembly rooms questions answered
text: radio derby 's political reporter has rustled up this video faq on the city council 's plans for replacing the assembly rooms .
your # derby assembly rooms questions answered
nailed that then : - )
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricketer shiv thakor facing sexual exposure charges
text: derbyshire cricketer shiv thakor is due to appear at derby magistrates ' court to answer two charges of sexual exposure .
it follows reports of two incidents on 12 and 19 of june at a housing development off radbourne lane in mackworth , derbyshire police said .

in a statement issued by derbyshire county cricket club , it said : `` in consultation with the player 's representatives , the player continues to be suspended on full pay and he is suspended from all cricket activity by ecb . ''
the club said the 23-year-old player was `` not on duty with the club '' at the time of the alleged incidents .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: us embassy learns about notts pilgrim links
text: nottinghamshire has been showing off its pilgrim links to staff from the us embassy this week .
lew lukens , deputy chief of mission at the us embassy in london , was visiting nottingham to take part in the robin hood marathon .
but during his visit he spent time hearing about the pilgrim fathers and nottingham 's bid to become european capital of culture .
radio nottingham has been campaigning to honour the likes of william brewster , from scrooby , who sailed on the mayflower in 1620 .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottinghamshire hos 'does incredible things '
text: the hard work of staff at nottinghamshire hos has been recognised by the county council 's chairman .
councillor john handley has chosen the hos as his charity for the year and said the hos did a `` phenomenal amount '' of work .
he said : nottinghamshire hos does incredible things .
it does a phenomenal amount of work and it really does fulfil its motto of 'adding life to days ' . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shortage of bungalows but demand continues
text: there is a growing demand for bungalows across leicestershire but there is a shortage of the properties , a developer said .
some single-floor properties are selling for up to twice the price of homes with stairs in the county .
developer william ashmore is looking specifically at building bungalows in leicestershire .
he said : `` no developers are building bungalows due to the amount of ground they take up .
`` they are steering towards two and three storey houses crammed in everywhere , so we see the need and are trying to put them where we can . ''
according to the national house building council in 1996 , 7 % of new build properties were bungalows but today that number has dropped to just 1 % .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: chris williamson : 'the zeitgeist has shifted '
text: `` the zeitgeist has shifted and people are looking for a radical alternative , '' says shadow minister and derby north mp chris williamson at the labour party conference in brighton .
assistant political editor norman smith asks him whether labour should `` tailor its message to middle england '' .
`` people are sick to death of that , '' mr williamson says .
voters `` see labour as offering a traditional , socialist alternative '' .
he adds : `` we should n't have a situation where people are sleeping on the streets and people struggling to make ends meet . ''
and the mp predicts the party could have a million members in the future .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: memorial garden for babies in staveley
text: a new memorial garden has been opened in staveley to remember babies who were either still born or died at an early age .
the garden has been created in the children 's corner of staveley cemetery by chesterfield sands , the local branch of the stillbirth and neo-natal death charity .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: toy trains and lego stolen by burglars
text: thieves stole a load of lego and a thomas the tank engine train set after breaking in to a house in ilkeston .
police said a tv , computer equipment and two guitars were also taken during the burglary in norman street last month .
details of the theft have only just been released .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : lunch squirrel
text: whatever you 've got planned for lunch , let 's hope you enjoy it as much as this squirrel is enjoying his apple .
photo by maggie t in east leake .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cctv appeal after war memorial trees vandalised
text: officers have released cctv images of a man they want to speak to in connection to the vandalism of war memorial trees .
someone climbed over the fence to loughborough endowed schools where they snapped the bases of a number of cherry trees , leicestershire police said .
it happened on august 25 at about 21:30 .
the trees were planted in the quadrangle , which is a memorial to the former staff and pupils who have lost their lives in conflicts over the last 100 years .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pick your county team of the season
text: pick your county team of the season

documents.title: disabled bodybuilder 's wedding 'vow '
text: disabled bodybuilder 's wedding 'vow '

documents.title: boy and adults need paramedic treatment after kitchen blaze
text: a boy and two adults needed checking over by paramedics after a kitchen fire in burton last night .
staffordshire fire service says it was called to broadway streeat at 21:05 and found the blaze was caused by cooking being left unattended .
it says west midlands ambulance service checked the man , woman and child to see if they 'd suffered after breathing in smoke .
# burton crew attend fire involving unattended cooking .
2 adults 1 child receive precautionary check by @ twitterid # lookwhenyoucook
author: Allen Cook
BBC News

documents.title: man suffers facial injuries after an attack
text: police have released a cctv image of a teenager they want to speak to in connection with an attack .
it happened after three boys were seen messing around on a roof and were told to get down in mansfield road , nottinghamshire police said .
a man suffered facial injuries and was taken to the queen 's medical centre on 19 september .
the boys were all black , one was said to be around 6ft tall , about 15-years-old , of a slim build and was wearing a black top with a white pattern and black bottoms .
the other two were around 5ft tall and around eight to 12-years-old and were both wearing black .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: youngs : players are 'at their limit ' with game schedule
text: england and leicester scrum-half ben youngs says the number of games at the moment is `` at the limit '' .
his comments come amid concern players are being made to play too often - but he says he trusts the game 's higher powers to make the right call .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: assembly rooms 'needs knocking down '
text: we 're still getting lots of comments on facebook about plans to replace derby 's assembly rooms with a new £ 32m venue ( plus a £ 10m car park ) .
jack bryan posted : `` so long as they knock it down i do n't care .
i 'll do the whole building with a sledgehammer for free .
the assembly rooms needs putting down as violently as possible - whatever replaces it ca n't possibly be as hideous as it is . ''
`` brilliant .
and when there 's no live gig or comedy it could be used as a nightclub a la rock city in notts , '' wrote james burton .
but kev wood is n't keen , writing : `` the new design looks worse than what 's there now . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: car thefts on the rise
text: the number of cars reported as stolen is on the rise in nottinghamshire according to new figures .
through a freedom of information request rac insurance found the number of incidents reported to nottinghamshire police went up to just under 1,600 last year - a 13 % rise from 2013 .
almost 86,000 vehicles were stolen in 2016 nationally , which is up from about 66,000 in 2013 .
the rac thinks the figures suggest that thieves are now getting to grips with ways to beat modern vehicle security systems .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: angry man hit woman and attacked car
text: police are hunting for a man who assaulted a woman he 'd been arguing with and then attacked the wing mirror of a nearby car queuing in traffic .
it happened near the queensway traffic lights in kedleston road , derby , at about 16:45 on sunday .
derbyshire police said they were particularly keen to hear from anyone with dashcam footage of the attack .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: national fitness day # getinspired
text: it 's national fitness day with plenty of fitness centres putting on free taster sessions or open days .
all you need to do to get involved is type in your local postcode into the national fitness day activity finder and see what 's available near you .
if you 're still not sure , we 've put together five suggestions for you .

documents.title: redevelopment plans to boost tourism
text: plans to redevelop st george 's barracks will boost tourism in rutland according to the council leader .
rutland county council and the ministry of defence will work together over the next two years to produce a master plan for when the barracks in north luffenham closes in 2020 .
the site could be transformed into a garden village which would include housing and businesses , as well as leisure and recreation facilities .

council leader toby mathias said : `` we kind of see it as a garden village so it will be quality and not quantity , ( with ) plenty of recreational space it will be huge benefit to tourism in this area . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : gunpoint robbery at loughborough betting shop
text: police have released video footage of an armed robbery at a betting shop in loughborough .
a staff member at ladbrokes in cattle market had a gun pointed at them and was ordered to hand over cash during the raid on 14 july .
police have now asked for the public 's help in identifying the robber .
call 101 if you can help .
warning : third party content may include adverts .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: notts pair for ashes series
text: nottinghamshire 's jake ball and stuart broad have been included in england 's 16-man squad for the ashes .
the series begins in brisbane on 23 november .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derby trains disrupted after person hit
text: derby trains disrupted after person hit
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: eu sugar rule change could increase jobs
text: changes on how much sugar can be made in the uk could see an increase in jobs at a newark firm .
the change in eu regulations which will come into force at the weekend will remove limits on how much sugar companies can export .
paul kenward , managing director at british sugar in newark , said : `` british sugar , believe it or not , was only allowed to sell 1.056 tonnes of sugar a year .
`` if we produced more than that when the weather went our way and we had a good crop , we had to store it .
now we are able to sell it , we will look to invest in our supply chain so we can get sugar out to europe and beyond . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gas canister used to raid cash machine
text: here 's a little more on last night 's cash machine raid at the co-operative in kibworth .
leicestershire police said thieves used a gas canister to open the machine , in high street at about 00:40 , before stealing money from inside .
officers are now carrying out a forensic search and checking cctv footage .
a local resident said on twitter they heard a loud boom , followed by drilling and the sound of a car driving away at high speed .
thieves attack cash machine in kibworth
the boom was so unbelievably loud , followed by drilling and then the getaway car zoomed away down high street .
looks crazy , little village and some scumbags target the local shop .

documents.title: rowett disappointed as rams denied win by late goal
text: derby county boss gary rowett described the late equaliser conceded by his team at brentford last night as `` sloppy '' and `` really poor '' .
the rams led 1-0 going into the final stages at griffin park before an 86th minute strike by ollie watkins meant they had to settle for a point .
rowett said : `` it was a sloppy goal to give away .
we had dealt with virtually everything they threw at us .
to concede a goal like that was really poor . ''
the draw leaves them 15th in the table - six points off the play-off places .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cork and wood to leave derbyshire
text: cork and wood to leave derbyshire

documents.title: cricket : pair set to leave derbyshire
text: derbyshire says tom wood and greg cork are to leave the club at the end of the current campaign after being told their contracts are not being renewed .
wood has played four times for the club while cork has made 15 appearances since joining in 2014 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thieves attack cash machine in kibworth
text: it appears a cash machine at the co-operative in kibworth was targeted by thieves last night .
leicestershire police say they will share more details about the attack shortly .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cambridge student is first in family to go to university
text: news has been talking to state school pupils who have made it to cambridge university .
they include alfreton 's john severn .
he clinched his place to study maths after getting four a grades at a-level .
remarkably , he 's the first in his immediate family to go to university .
`` everyone assumes that i 'm going to start rowing , '' he says .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: theatre community 'disappointed ' by assembly rooms replacement
text: derby 's arts and theatre association has criticised the city council 's plans for a £ 32m venue to replace the assembly rooms .
chairman steve dunning said the authority had failed to honour its promise to consult members about the design of the new building , which would have no provision to host major theatre productions .
mr dunning said : `` we feel the council is going for the cheaper option when it should be bold and go for the proper option . ''
the council has been invited to comment .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: smuggled drugs found in granola box
text: the bbc was given exclusive access to see how smuggled drugs and weapons are being seized at east midlands airport .
in the past officers have caught heroin stitched into boxing gloves and in one case the back of a television screen was replaced by four blocks of cocaine .
andy plumb , a border force officer , showed us a box which was believed to be filled with drugs .
he said : `` it was described as breakfast granola but it looks like cannabis , it smells like cannabis . ''
tests confirmed it contained drugs .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: soup kitchen reports rise in users
text: a group which hands out hot meals and clothes to the homeless has seen a rise in the number of people it supports .
walkers notts which meets weekly in sneinton said they see about 80 people a week compared to 20 people just 11 months ago .
denise walker , from the group , said : `` they are just young and old vulnerable people we are getting different people all the time .
`` we have had a few pregnant ladies i do n't know if they are homeless but they are coming here for help . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police continue to question fleckney murder suspect
text: a man arrested on sus of murdering a pensioner in a leicestershire village is still in police custody .
the body of an elderly woman was discovered at her home in fleckney , near market harborough , on sunday morning .
the 25-year-old man was arrested in the fleckney area yesterday .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east midlands roads round-up
text: so how are the roads in our region looking this morning ?
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more warning signs on busy road
text: more warning signs could be installed on a busy road in derby after complaints from residents .
people living and working in markeaton lane have said drivers are taking the sharp corners too quickly .
derby city council is now considering putting up more warning signs about the bends ahead .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : today 's weather for the east midlands
text: here 's what wednesday has in store for us .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire .
gavin bevis and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live
